paragraphs: The RACP's mission to support physician training and professional development resonates strongly with my experience building operational excellence across complex, multi-stakeholder environments. Having led cross-functional teams and managed regional operations at enterprise scale, I understand the unique challenges of translating national strategies into effective local delivery while maintaining stakeholder alignment.

Your requirement for someone who can lead teams, manage budgets, and foster cooperative stakeholder relationships aligns directly with my track record. As Group Executive - Operations at Orro Group, I led 100+ person teams across multiple regions, managing P&L responsibilities while driving 2% EBITDA improvement through operational excellence. My experience integrating 11 companies taught me how to embed consistent practices across diverse locations while respecting local needs - skills directly applicable to ensuring NSW/ACT alignment with national RACP standards.

The secretariat support and committee management aspects particularly appeal to me, as they combine my strategic planning capabilities with hands-on execution. My project management experience delivering competing priorities on time and on budget, combined with my financial management skills, positions me well to manage the State Office budget while identifying opportunities to streamline processes and improve service efficiency. I'm drawn to the opportunity to make a meaningful impact on medical workforce development, contributing to the vital work of training Australia's future physicians.

I'm excited about the 3-2-1 hybrid model and the opportunity to build strong relationships with NSW and ACT Health, HETI, and local health districts. My collaborative leadership style and commitment to performance improvement would enable me to coach the team effectively while ensuring high-quality member services for Fellows and Trainees.
